name: pugnaciously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows someone wants to start an argument or fight, or has a very strong opinion about something : The older boy stared pugnaciously at the camera. "A lot of what went on was bullying," she says pugnaciously.
More examplesFewer examplesThey are pugnaciously willing to defend their views against any criticism.She stuck out her chin pugnaciously as she glared at him.He says that he is a businessman, but also claims, a little pugnaciously, to be a socialist.
